duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage the implementation of new and modified engineered labor standards in warehouse operations.
Support regional projects in warehouse automation, slotting, facility layout, and transportation, recommending cost-effective solutions.
Train warehouse and delivery staff in efficient work methods and process simulations before deploying new labor standards.
Serve as a mentor and adviser to divisional personnel in work methods, labor standards, and efficiency techniques.
Monitor and analyze warehouse and delivery operations to measure productivity metrics and identify opportunities for efficiencies.
Maintain relations with vendors throughout the implementation process.
Defend labor work methods and time standards in union audits and OSHA complaints.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, required (Industrial Engineering degree preferred).
